hero.title: Your platform to manage reptiles
hero.subtitle: SnakeBee was created to simplify the daily management of snake, gecko, and other reptile breeding. Everything in one app.

1.title: Register your reptiles
1.desc: Add information about species, morph, sex, and photos.

2.title: Manage feeding and health
2.desc: Track meals, sheds, feces, and vet visits with one click.

3.title: Organize breeding
3.desc: Plan pairings, births, and monitor baby growth.

dataSafety.title: SnakeBee keeps your data safe
dataSafety.desc: A simple, fast interface designed for breeders.

services.title: What you can do with SnakeBee

list.reptileManagement2: Weight, feeding, health events, and documentation.
list.notifications2: Automatic emails for feedings and event reminders.
list.organizedData2: Filter by species, sex, age, morph, and more.
list.inventory2: Manage stocks of mice, rats, and chicks with premium access.
list.calendar2: Unify feedings, health events, breeding, and custom events.
list.export2: Download all your breeding data in Excel or PDF format.
list.stats2: Analyze success rates, incubation, and feeding trends.

management.title: ü¶é Reptile Management
management.desc: Complete records for each animal with data on weight, diet, moults, veterinary visits, and official documents (CITES, microchip).

breeding.title: üêç Reproduction
breeding.desc: Organize pairs, add events (ovulation, laying, hatching), track babies, and get statistics on success and incubation.

notifications.title: üì© Automatic Notifications
notifications.desc: Receive email reminders about scheduled meals and important events. In the future: customizable notifications for every need.

inventory.title: ü•© Food Inventory
inventory.desc: Manage your supplies: automatic decrement with meals, quantity controls, and management of multiple food types.

calendar.title: üìÖ Calendar
calendar.desc: All your data together: meals, health events, breedings, and custom events in a single view.

export.title: üìä Exports
export.desc: Download detailed Excel and PDF files with animal records, meal history, events, breedings, and babies.

stats.title: üìà Stats
stats.desc: Discover rejection rates, average molt intervals, reproductive success rates, and other useful metrics.

futureGoals.title: What we want to build
futureGoals.desc: SnakeBee is just starting, but we have big goals. We want to become the reference point for reptile breeders in Italy, offering more advanced tools, an active community, and a complete ecosystem.

about.title: About us
about.desc: SnakeBee was born from the idea of a reptile enthusiast, with the goal of creating a simple but powerful tool for those who, like us, have turned this passion into part of their life. The entire platform was developed from scratch, without funding, without a team, just with determination and love for this world. Our mission is to offer something concrete and useful to the Italian community of breeders, professionals, and enthusiasts.

premium.description: For breeders and advanced users who want it all.

tips: Some reptiles need UVB spots for metabolism and strong bones ü¶é‚òÄÔ∏è
Ever thought of environmental enrichment? Tunnels and hides reduce stress üê¢
Remember: half the terrarium should be cooler, the other warmer üå°Ô∏è for thermoregulation
Lizards and geckos love to climb! Add steps or branches to stimulate them ü¶é
Dust insects with calcium, don‚Äôt press it in. Better to dust every time üêõüßÇ
Frequent cleaning prevents mold: remove feces and old shed daily üßº
A snake‚Äôs forked tongue is for ‚Äòsmelling‚Äô the environment, not just for style üòè
Chameleons don‚Äôt change color just to ‚Äòcamouflage‚Äô ‚Äî it‚Äôs for temperature control or communication üé®
Never handle a snake right after it has eaten. It just had a royal feast üëëüêç
Don‚Äôt keep two males in the same terrarium. If they don‚Äôt fight, they ignore each other‚Ä¶ or worse üëä
Humidity for a ball python should stay between 50‚Äì60%. Too much can cause mold and infections üíß
During shedding, don‚Äôt force the snake‚Äôs skin. Offer a tub of warm water instead üõÅ
Turtles do NOT hibernate randomly. It requires temperature and monitoring, or it‚Äôs life-threatening ‚ùÑÔ∏è
Did you know? Snakes don‚Äôt have eyelids. What you see is an ‚Äòeye scale‚Äô üêçüëÅÔ∏è
Never put your hands in a terrarium right after handling food. Now you‚Äôre the snack üçó‚û°Ô∏èüñêÔ∏è
Some lizards can regrow their tail, but it‚Äôs not an infinite trick. Careful! üîÅ
Clean the water bowl regularly: many bacteria love stagnant water üö∞
Reptiles aren‚Äôt ‚Äòcold-blooded‚Äô: they are ectothermic! They use external heat üåû
Never feed prey bigger than the snake‚Äôs head. It‚Äôs a mouth, not a suitcase üß≥üêç
A terrarium without hides is like a house without a bathroom: unlivable üòÖ
Not all reptiles bite‚Ä¶ but the ones that do have perfect aim üò¨üéØ
Some snakes hiss or blow. They‚Äôre not angry ‚Äî just drama queens üêçüí®
Don‚Äôt use scented substrates. Reptiles don‚Äôt want to live in an air freshener üå≤üòµ
